metadata.feature_description: Like and unlike posts and comments in the activity stream

steps.action: Navigate to Community page with Activity Stream
steps.expected: Activity Stream displays with posts having Like buttons
steps.actual: Activity Stream loaded with multiple posts showing Like buttons

steps.action: Click Like button on Test User12's badge post
steps.expected: Like button changes to Unlike, 'You like this' message appears
steps.actual: Like button changed to Unlike, 'You like this' message appeared below the post

steps.action: Click Unlike button on the previously liked post
steps.expected: Unlike button changes back to Like, 'You like this' message disappears
steps.actual: Unlike button changed back to Like, 'You like this' message disappeared

steps.action: Like the Group Wiki Test Article post
steps.expected: Like button changes to Unlike, like count indicator shows 'You like this'
steps.actual: Like button changed to Unlike, 'You like this' indicator appeared showing the current user's like status

steps.action: Create a new post using the 'Tell the world something...' input
steps.expected: New post is created and appears in the Activity Stream
steps.actual: New post 'Test post to verify like own post' was created and appeared at the top of the Activity Stream

steps.action: Click Like button on own post
steps.expected: User can like their own post, Like changes to Unlike
steps.actual: Successfully liked own post - Like button changed to Unlike, 'You like this' appeared

steps.action: Click Comment button on a post to open comment form
steps.expected: Comment form opens allowing text entry
steps.actual: Comment form opened with Reply and Cancel buttons

steps.expected: Comment is posted and appears with a Like button
steps.actual: Unable to successfully submit comment through the UI - the comment form required additional interaction that was not achievable during testing. Code review confirms comment likes are supported (LikeComment/UnlikeComment endpoints exist).

issues: Could not complete comment submission to test comment like functionality. Code review confirms the feature exists (likecomment-{commentId} elements and LikeComment/UnlikeComment API endpoints in ActivityStreamParser.cs and JavaScript files).

observations: Code review confirms comment likes are fully implemented in the codebase (ActivityStreamParser.cs line 855 shows likecomment-{commentId} buttons, and JavaScript files include LikeComment/UnlikeComment handlers)
The Activity Stream supports multiple post types including badges, wiki articles, privileges, and user-created posts
Like functionality uses the ToggleLike API endpoint which handles both like and unlike operations in a single toggle
Like status is visually indicated with 'You like this' text and the button label changes between 'Like' and 'Unlike'
Multiple users liking the same post was not explicitly tested as it requires logging in as different users, but the code supports this with aggregated like displays
